txt.en: 'I must not give up all hope for poor Hal, though in a place as cruel as this I dare not hold too much....\n\n'We must hunt down the black dogs that cornered him and see if we can find any clues to confirm his downfall... or perhaps a body so that we might at least put him to rest, though the Black Dogs are rarely so considerate as to leave much behind.'

'What are these...? No!

'Are these all that remains of Hal Tiller? I was a fool to ever let him come here!

'I will see his bravery avenged! The creature who did this deed must pay thrice-fold!'

'What possessed an innocent such as Hal to join us out here? These halflings are not known for such spirit so far as I have heard, though tales do speak of a few. Nevertheless, even the boldest halfling should not come to such a place as this!'
Ivorel feels personally responsible for poor Hal Tiller, a young hobbit that accompanied her scout expedition.
Black dogs can be found throughout the Scuttledells.\n\nIvorel has asked you to hunt down black dogs in the hopes of finding some clue -- or perhaps the remains -- of Hal Tiller.
Talk to Ivorel at her camp
Ivorel is at her camp in the Scuttledells.\n\nYou should return to Ivorel and show her the remains that you have collected.
